detail.content: The Plague — NYU's Only Intentionally Funny Publication                The Plague    NYU’s Only Intentionally Funny Publication        Skip to the navigation        Welcome to the online home for The Plague , coincidentally both the most- and least-homoerotic student publication in the Mid-Atlantic. A free magazine with a hard-working staff would normally make their content available on the web. We may be free, but we’re certainly not hard-working, so don’t get your hopes up.   The Plague is one of the few surviving outlets for humor in Lower Manhattan since the Bird Flu Epidemic of 2005. Drop by a meeting sometime: Mondays at 6:30 P.M. in Room 708 of the Kimmel Center .   If you’ve made it this far (by my count, it’s been 96 words), read our sample articles and lists or our investigation into the history and beginnings of The Plague . But to best ingratiate yourself with the staff, to later swindle us, come to our meetings or sign up for our mailing list .   If you’re busy during our meetings, or just lazy, you can send all contributions to plague.magazine@gmail.com .             Visit our new web site, Lists by The Plague !     History of The Plague     Featured Articles and Lists!     Beware the Ides of March     Beware the Ideas of Mark     Beware the Ikeas of Newark     Join our mailing list!              I'll never forget the day I learned about the birds and the bees: September 11, 2001. Pretty freaky, huh? Not to mention that I was born on Halloween.
